subject: Productivity
title: Tunnel Vision and Unethical Behavior
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Tunnel Vision and Unethical Behavior.

hook.text: Wells Fargo employees created millions of fake accounts. The culprit? Aggressive sales goals.

buildup.text: Harvard researchers warned that goals can cause tunnel vision. People chase the metric at any cost.

discovery.text: Sears auto shops overcharged customers to hit repair quotas. Enron cooked books to meet earnings targets.

twist.text: The goals weren't wrong. The systems around them were. Goals without ethical guardrails become dangerous.

climax.text: Goals are powerful tools. Like any powerful tool, they require safety mechanisms.

punchline.text: A goal without ethics is just a recipe for fraud.

quiz.question: What did Harvard researchers warn about aggressive goals?
options: They can cause tunnel vision and unethical behavior
They only work in financial settings
